nodes.bodyText: In some samples we specify which basemap style, do we want to do this as a standard?

Mostly the logic was that we'd include it if it said it previously since it was there, and not if it didn't as I personally don't think it adds anything when it's written there clearly in the ENUM. And in this specific case I removed it as it was incorrect anyway.
If we want it to be consistent one way or the other I can go back through. One for @Rachael-E to add to and see what we think if it's worth it. We can at least agree what we want going forward for new samples, and can add it as a line in the Contrib Guide.
Same comment as above, do we want to specify the style everywhere, or is it just 'clutter'?
We've gone with consistently adding in create a map with the insert-name basemap style
Nice catch on the import order here 👍

This reads a bit funky as opposed to how it was with basemap type. Maybe we can be a bit more verbose here?
I'm sure there will be other opinions on this, so feel free to leave it:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            1. Create an `ArcGISMap` with a `BasemapStyle.OSM_STANDARD`.
          
          
            
            1. Create an `ArcGISMap` with a the OSM standard basemap style `BasemapStyle.OSM_STANDARD`.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,7 +14,7 @@ When the sample opens, it will automatically display the map with the OpenStreet
 
 ## How it works
 
-1. Create an `ArcGISMap` with a `Basemap.Type.OPEN_STREET_MAP`.
+1. Create an `ArcGISMap` with a `BasemapStyle.OSM_STANDARD`.

nodes.bodyText: Thanks I've updated. Also just a general note incase it crosses anyone's mind (CC @Rachael-E ) - there is no plan to update the designs right now, that will be a future release job, so we're just to make our SDK updates as necessary for now.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,7 +14,7 @@ When the sample opens, it will automatically display the map with the OpenStreet
 
 ## How it works
 
-1. Create an `ArcGISMap` with a `Basemap.Type.OPEN_STREET_MAP`.
+1. Create an `ArcGISMap` with a `BasemapStyle.OSM_STANDARD`.
